revised_title: Cooperativity and Regulation in Virus Assembly: Conformational Changes and Phage Maturation
tldr: The article discusses the assembly and maturation of viruses, focusing on the role of cooperativity and regulation through conformational changes. The author explains how sequential interactions of proteins and packaging of nucleic acids contribute to the formation of virus particles. The study of phage assembly provides experimental model systems for understanding gene product regulation and the processes involved in virus formation.
